solution.p:
Follow the order of operations: compute powers before products.
f(2)=8 \cdot 4^2 = 8\cdot 16 = 128
f(-2)=8 \cdot 4^{-2} = 8\cdot \dfrac{1}{16} = \dfrac{1}{2}
f(\frac{1}{2})=8 \cdot 4^{1/2} = 8\cdot 2 = 16
f(-\frac{1}{2})=8 \cdot 4^{-1/2} = 8\cdot \dfrac{1}{2} = 4

The number of students at Salt Creek Elementary School is growing according to the formula ~f(t)=500(1.08)^t~, where t is the number of years since the school opened in 2005.
What does the equation ~f(6)=500(1.08)^6~ tell us about the school?
Use function notation to say that the student population was 583 in 2007.

ol.label: a
ol.li: In this equation, t=6 and f(6)=793. In 2011 (six years after the school opened), the student population was 793.

statement.p:
The value of Digicorp stock has been falling according to the formula ~V(w)=48(0.96)^w~, where w is the number of weeks since its peak value of $48 per share.
Use function notation to say that 8 weeks later the value of a share of Digicorp stock was $34.63.
What does the equation ~V(12) = 48(0.96)^{12} = 29.41~ tell us about the stock?

ol.label: a
ol.li: We evaluate the function at w=8 to get ~V(8) = 48(0.96)^8 = 34.63.
In this equation, w=12 and V(12) = 29.41, so 12 weeks after the peak value a share of Digicorp stock was worth $29.41.

statement.p: Here is a graph of f(x)=x^2+2x-16. Use the graph to solve the equation x^2+2x-16=8. Show your work on the graph.

solution.p: To solve the equation, we want to find x-values that produce a function value of 8. Each point on the graph has coordinates (x,f(x)) for a different value of x, and the vertical coordinate of each point is given by the function value, f(x). So we look for points on the graph with vertical coordinate f(x)=8.

There are two such points, (-6,8) and (4,8). Those points tell us that f(-6)=8 and f(4)=8. Thus, the x-coordinates of the points, namely -6 and 4, are the solutions. To check algebraically, we can verify that f(-6)=8 and f(4)=8: \begin{aligned}[t] f(-6) \amp = (-6)^2+2(-6)-16 = 36-12-16 = 8\\ f(4)\amp = 4^2+2(4)-16 = 16+8-16 = 8 \end{aligned}

statement.p: Here is a graph of G(x)=\dfrac{20}{(x-3)^2}. Use the graph to solve the equation \dfrac{20}{(x-3)^2} = 5. Show your work on the graph.

solution.p: We find any points on the graph with vertical coordinate G(x)=5. There are two points, (1,5) and (5,5.) The x-coordinates of those points, namely 1 and 5, are the solutions.
